column4: stupid question: is the proper Firefox icon included with Ubuntu... i want to use that on my Gnome bar instead of the Globe icon
no, the Mozilla people won't let ubuntu include it
they're very protective of their trademark
is there anywhere to d/l the icon? alot of the screenshots i've seen of linux im sure include the firefox icon on shortcuts
lots of distributions are not nearly as careful about this sort of thing as Debian and Ubuntu
I'm sure it's on the firefox website somewhere
power down. swap cards. power up.
is it because they both use the same nvidia drivers?
if they used different drivers, there'd be an extra step
for my learning... what step would that be?
sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg, pick the correct driver
oh, yes i should have figured that out myself, thanks again :)
